title: Drawing, "Design for Wallpaper Border", 1825–50
medium: Brush and black ink, gouache on dark blue paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: In the center an escutcheon with an empty oval. Beside, a kind of altar lamp suspended at the end of a rinceau, upon which a bird sits; it originates from the inner top of a framed oval, in which stands below a basket with flowers. The ground is blue. The border is red and brown.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Wallpaper Border", 1825–50.
1825–50. Brush and black ink, gouache on dark blue paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5287.
